Description: Two sherds from an Attic red-figured pottery open vase, probably stamnos. a) legs and himation of a male moving left. b) upper part of inside glazed; exterior, upper part of youth, head turned to right, with kylix raised in his right hand.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
While Beazley has this as a column-krater, the part-glazing of the inside suggests a stamnos. The precise position of the figure is uncertain, whether standing in a komos or seated in the symposium.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (120, pl. 66, 10-11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0980)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
